Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: The only problem is, the reddit app is one of the major reasons for reddit's downfall. It being thought of as an app instead of a forum brought in a much different type of audience and caused old reddit to be pretty much abandoned. This paved the way for drastic changes in both direction and policy, including harsher moderation. It basically went from a discussion site to a social media site like facebook that has to be "welcoming" and politically correct, and take an active stance on political and social issues.
body_html: The only problem is, the reddit app is one of the major reasons for reddit's downfall. It being thought of as an app instead of a forum brought in a much different type of audience and caused old reddit to be pretty much abandoned. This paved the way for drastic changes in both direction and policy, including harsher moderation. It basically went from a discussion site to a social media site like facebook that has to be "welcoming" and politically correct, and take an active stance on political and social issues.

body: This actually seems like the better idea, as Ruqqus' UI does seem to scale pretty well on different screens. I mean, I haven't tried a stupid-low res like 800x600, but from 1920x1080 (and the inverses of..) through 3840x2160, and whatever res iPad Pros/Galaxy Tab S2s are at full screen; and resized windows on those same screen look great as well (except for shrinking it as far as it'll go on a 4k, then it's terrible, so don't do that).
body_html: This actually seems like the better idea, as Ruqqus' UI does seem to scale pretty well on different screens. I mean, I haven't tried a stupid-low res like 800x600, but from 1920x1080 (and the inverses of..) through 3840x2160, and whatever res iPad Pros/Galaxy Tab S2s are at full screen; and resized windows on those same screen look great as well (except for shrinking it as far as it'll go on a 4k, then it's terrible, so don't do that).

post.title: I know this is site is new and relatively small.....BUT

body:
HTML is pretty outdated I think. I did learn it a good while ago but I've forgotten it now and considering how many browsers (such as Chrome) are preferring scripts and deprecating HTML, I'd say that it's gonna become legacy pretty quickly. Especially in mobile platforms, only HTML is pretty bad. 

I'd say do a favor for Kek and learn vue. 

I would've been learning programming and scripting by myself right now, had only if the virus never been so widespread and my college entrance exams wouldn't have been so delayed.
body_html:
HTML is pretty outdated I think. I did learn it a good while ago but I've forgotten it now and considering how many browsers (such as Chrome) are preferring scripts and deprecating HTML, I'd say that it's gonna become legacy pretty quickly. Especially in mobile platforms, only HTML is pretty bad.

I'd say do a favor for Kek and learn vue.

I would've been learning programming and scripting by myself right now, had only if the virus never been so widespread and my college entrance exams wouldn't have been so delayed.

body: There's nothing outdated about HTML. It's also not getting deprecated, you're probably talking about [HTML Imports](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Web_Components/HTML_Imports).
